summary: The Federal Housing Administration helps increase homeownership by insuring mortgage loans that have less strict standards and lower down payments than conventional loans. The housing crisis of 2007-2011 led to historic rates of mortgage defaults, many of which were insured by FHA. FHA can sell these loans in order to limit its losses from defaults. We found that the defaulted loans FHA sold were more...
title: Federal Housing Administration: Opportunities Exist to Improve Defaulted Single-Family Loan Sales
